intro: Hieracium coloriscapum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium coloriscapum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
